result.execSummary:
The defendant Deborah Echols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deborah Echols

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: The defendant's motion or request for release privileges is DENIED; signed and filed.  The court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for release to the DRC.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR SPEEDY DISPOSITION COURT.....
Defendant Deborah Echols in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Deborah Echols in custody.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel, and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time, concurrent to each other, and concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. Court allows "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT".
Credit for 29 days time served.

OTHER COURT ORDERS (AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3):
* Defendant to PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid within 90 days of release.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Defendant to pay all other applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid within 90 days of release.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given. 

Court CANCELED the 02-27-2015 at 8:30 AM Plea and Sentencing Hearing date before Judge Siefert's Court.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

FILED:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR SPEEDY DISPOSITION COURT.....
Defendant Deborah Echols in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Deborah Echols in custody.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:  Defendant changes her plea to "NO CONTEST".  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Per the parties request, case is calendared on the speedy dispo calendar for a plea and sentencing hearing on 02/13/2015 at 01:30 p.m. in Room 635 of the Courthouse, Judge Donald presiding.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Deborah Echols not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Deborah Echols not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Defendant to be monitored by DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Deborah Echols in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Deborah Echols in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
